TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GridViewDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.
The properties of the GridViewDesigner class provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property returns a collection of formatting schemes for display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control and the top-level <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> templates.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> to generate the design-time markup.
The methods of the GridViewDesigner class provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.DataBind%2A> method binds the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control to a design-time data source.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> at design time.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.OnClick%2A> method is called when a region of the design-time view of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> is clicked.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.OnSchemaRefreshed%2A> method is called when the schema of the data source of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> changes.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to remove or add properties or to shadow properties of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>.
Design-time editable regions are not supported in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control, so the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> methods have no functionality.
## Examples The following code example shows how to extend the GridViewDesigner class to change the appearance of controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control at design time.
The example derives the `MyGridView` control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>. The `MyGridView` is simply a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>. The example also derives the `MyGridViewDesigner` class from the GridViewDesigner class and places a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> object for the `MyGridViewDesigner` on the `MyGridView` control.
The `MyGridViewDesigner` overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method to make the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Page%2A> property visible in the **Properties** grid at design time. It overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to include the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Caption%2A> property, if it is specified, as a new first row in the `MyGridView` control at design time. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property of the `MyGridView` control has the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> value, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> draws a blue dashed border around the control to make its extent more visible.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.design.w_10_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.w_10_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the designer action list collection for this designer.
Gets or sets the collection of predefined formatting schemes to display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.
Docs.value: A that contains the predefined schemes for the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection> object is populated from an XML-encoded member of an internal class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void DataBind(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl dataBoundControl) cil managed

Docs.param: The to bind to the design-time data source.
Docs.summary: Binds the associated control to the design-time data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The DataBind method binds the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control to the design-time data source and assigns a unique value to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion.DesignerRegionAttributeName> field of each cell of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control's design-time rendering.
The `dataBoundControl` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control that is associated with this designer, or a copy of that control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.String> containing the markup used to render the at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetDesignTimeHtml method does the following:
1. Sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.AutoGenerateColumns%2A> property of the control to `true`, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Columns%2A> property is empty.
2. Sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.DataKeyNames%2A> property of the control to `null`, if the schema of the data source cannot be obtained.
3. Refreshes the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object to force the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method to be called.
4. Calls the base method to generate the markup.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the GetDesignTimeHtml method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner> class to change the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control at design time. The example adds a new first row to the grid to contain the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Caption%2A> property, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Caption%2A> is defined. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property of the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> class has the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> value, the GetDesignTimeHtml draws a blue dashed border around the control to make its extent more visible. It does not change the run-time appearance of the control.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.design.w_15_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.design.w_15_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml(class System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection regions) cil managed

Docs.param: A to which definitions of the selectable and clickable regions in the design-time view of the control are added.
Docs.summary: Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time and populates a collection of designer regions.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.String> containing the markup used to render the at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetDesignTimeHtml method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml> method to generate the markup for the design-time rendering of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control. The GetDesignTimeHtml also populates `regions` with a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> object for each clickable or selectable region of the design-time rendering.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>, the first cell in each row is selectable; all the cells in the rows are clickable.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner> class to change the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control at design time. The example adds a new first row to the grid to contain the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Caption%2A> property, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Caption%2A> is defined. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property of the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> class has the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> value, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> draws a blue dashed border around the control to make its extent more visible. It does not change the run-time appearance of the control.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/32004a20-8eaa-4301-95af-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/32004a20-8eaa-4301-95af-_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region) cil managed

Docs.param: The for which to fetch content.
Docs.summary: Returns the content for an editable region of the design-time view of the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This functionality is currently not available.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed

Docs.summary: Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The designer host calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control. The Initialize and its base methods configure properties and set up events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control that is associated with this designer, or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnClick(class System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: A that defines the clicked region of the control.
Docs.summary: Called when a region of the design-time view of the associated control is clicked.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The OnClick method saves the selected region index and updates the markup that renders the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control on the design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnSchemaRefreshed() cil managed

Docs.summary: Called when the schema of the data source for the associated control changes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unless the designer is in template-editing mode or a field is being added or edited, the OnSchemaRefreshed method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InvokeTransactedChange%2A> method, which in turn calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> method to update the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control to reflect the data source change.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection implementing the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> of the added and shadowed properties.
Docs.summary: Used by the designer to remove properties from or add additional properties to the display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add properties to or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control, the PreFilterProperties method sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute> object of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Columns%2A> property to `false` when the control is in template mode. This is so a column that is in template mode cannot be deleted using the **Fields** dialog box.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the PreFilterProperties method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner> to change the **Properties** grid of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control at design time. The example makes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Page%2A> property visible in the **Properties** grid.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/d11c1994-e9dc-4f3f-8d9f-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/d11c1994-e9dc-4f3f-8d9f-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of sample rows for the associated control to display.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control allows paging and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.PageSize%2A> property is greater than 0, the SampleRowCount property returns the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.PageSize%2A> plus 1 (but not greater than 100). If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> does not allow paging or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.PageSize%2A> is 0, SampleRowCount returns `5`.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent (System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content) cil managed

Docs.summary: Specifies content for an editable region of the design-time view for the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The SetEditableDesignerRegionContent method has no functionality; there is no support for editable regions in the design-time view of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated control.
Docs.value: A containing an element for each templated field in the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The TemplateGroups property constructs a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> objects, one for each templated data field and one for each control template (pager and empty data) in the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control. The data field <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> elements have a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition> object for each of the predefined row template types. The control template <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> elements contain a single <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition>.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.
Docs.value: if the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The UsePreviewControl property is always `true`, the designer uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control that contains a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control to generate the design-time markup. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>.
If the UsePreviewControl property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer will use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> itself to generate the design-time markup, and design-time changes to the control will persist to the page markup source.
